intro: Hypericophyllum hessii, commonly known as the Hess's hypericum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the family Hypericaceae, which includes several species of flowering shrubs. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and woody stems, typical of many members of its family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
